intro: Antirrhinum paui, commonly known as the Hawaiian Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the unique environmental conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly the honeycreeper, which is native to Hawaii. Antirrhinum paui is an important part of the local ecosystem and is considered a rare and endemic species.
